definition: to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: She procrastinated her return on varions pretexts.
sentences.chinese: 她以多種藉口推遲歸程。

sentences.english: The most amazing thing is he understood that he was in this death grip.
sentences.chinese: 最令人驚異的是他明白他正一步一步走向歸程。

sentences.english: Bitterly disappointed, Scott and his companions set out on the return journey.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特和他的夥伴們十分失望，便起身踏上歸程。

sentences.english: In the evening happily embark on return journey.
sentences.chinese: 在晚上，愉快地踏上歸程。

sentences.english: The return journey was made over the same route.
Amidst the Rain, What is the way?
On our way out we also got a quick archery lesson from one of the locals.
sentences.chinese: 在我們的歸程，我們還快速地學習了射箭。

sentences.english: Scott and his companions set out on the return journey.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特和他的夥伴們十分失望，便起身踏上歸程。

definition: to return home/fig. to retire from public life
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
to restore old way/to return to the past
to inspect one by one/to list individually
Baqiao District of Xi’an 西安市[Xi1 an1 Shi4], Shaanxi
Wanli township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
to go for a trip in spring
